title: No, they won't. / No, they're not. | WordReference Forums
text: IlyaTretyakov Banned Russian I just came across some lines in a movie, and I'd like to ask you if it's natural to repond to "subject + be + going + to do something" with "No, subject + won't", why? A: We need to get across that square. B: They're going to see us. A: No, they won't. Shouldn't the last line be "No, they're not"? Why? A: We need to get across that square. B: They're going to see us. A: No, they won't. Shouldn't the last line be "No, they're not"? Why?
